utterance.speaker: TYLER FARIS
utterance.content: C’mon, baby! Where you going? The party is just getting started!

utterance.speaker: MARIE MARCADO
utterance.content: Help! Somebody help me!

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Hey! Come here!

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: Get off me!

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Ah … shh. I’ll teach you to run from me.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Leave the girl alone.

utterance.speaker: TYLER
utterance.content: Why don’t you get lost before I take you down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, prepare to feast on the finest omelet in the land.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Before you join the convent.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, I am making costumes for my Shakespeare class. So, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I seem to remember asking you to make me an E.T. Halloween costume and you told me you didn’t know how to sew.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Details. Besides, you were thirty-two at the time. The point is, proper wardrobe helps an actor connect to the words.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Lady Macbeth, I presume?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Desdemona.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… Desdemona.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, you too. No, you hang up first. No, you. It’s your turn.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Stanford sounds so amazing. I can’t wait for January.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: January?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: When I leave. For Stanford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Alexis applied for spring admission. You remember.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I just thought … well, you haven’t talked about it for a long time so I thought …

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Because every time I did I saw the look on your face.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That look. Right there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I … honey, it’s just that Stanford is a big decision. I mean, you should… you should think it over.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I did. And there’s no downside. It’s a great university, Ashley’s there, I mean … I’ll have enough credits to graduate early.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but don’t you want to finish off senior year with your friends? Right? And, prom. Don’t you want to go to prom?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, Ashley just gave me his password so I can go check out his classes online.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Lady Beckett, my lord.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, are you crying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s the onions!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, I admit, it wasn’t just the onions. Not completely. I mean, she’s going to be gone in a few months. My little girl!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but she’s growing up, Castle. She’s going to be going to a great school. It’s what you want, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. I’m just not ready.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, she is. So you two are just not on the same page.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do I do?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let her go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me. If you hold on too tight you’ll just drive her away.

utterance.speaker: PAUL WHITTAKER
utterance.content: Detective! What can you tell us about this homicide?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no comment. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. For a murder in an alley? Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Officer Hastings, what’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER ANN HASTINGS
utterance.content: You should see for yourself, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Tell me about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, so he was …

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Split right down the middle. From the top of his head all the way down to his –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Eh!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Please. The guy was sliced in two. I’d say his unit is the least of his problems.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then you do not understand the sacred bond between a man and his unit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what was the murder weapon? Guillotine?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: A sword. The tip broke off in the body. Blood spatter indicates that the killer first lopped off the victim’s hand, then took the big swing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Single edged blade. Some kind of saber? Sword … that is so Game of Thrones.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, this looks like it could have been a ritual killing, so let’s get photos of all the bystanders in case the killer came back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On it. Meanwhile, the victim’s name is Tyler Faris. He just got out of Sing Sing a year ago for sexual assault.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We got any witnesses?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, the girl he was in the middle of assaulting. A Marie Marcado.

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: I met him last night at Matt’s bar around the corner. He seemed like a nice enough guy, talking all big about his ship coming in. Anyway, it got late. I left with him. But that’s when he started getting all super aggressive. I took off running, he caught me. I mean, God knows what he would have done if …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Conan the Barbarian hadn’t shown up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did the killer look like?

utterance.speaker: MARIE
utterance.content: It was so dark I didn’t really get to see his face.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn’t catch anything? Ethnicity? Age? Weight? Height?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s holding out on us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Conan probably saved her life. She doesn’t want to throw him under the bus. Or under a Ben Hur style chariot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but she saw the killer. Isn’t she afraid for her life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She probably knows he wasn’t after her. Career felon smited in two? It’s very Old Testament. This … this plays like a vigilante killing. Think Dirty Harry with a sword.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who just happens to be in the alley when Faris is committing a felony. That timing is a little suspicious. The killer probably followed him from the bar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: With a sword?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Touché. Let’s talk to the next of kin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Faris, we’re very sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pardon me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not in this century they don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why’s that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I see. Um … do you know if he was involved in anything that could have gotten him killed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He told someone that his ship was coming in. What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ma’am, um, I’ll need the names of all the enemies you son may have had.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Larceny, assault, fraud … you name it, Tyler Faris has done it. Still, nobody deserves ending up like that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He got what was coming to him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude. That’s for the criminal justice system to decide.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe a sword is a justice system.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, if you’re Quentin Tarantino, maybe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He made lots of calls to an untraceable burner phone in the last six months. Behavior consistent with a criminal dirtbag. Check this out. Tyler Faris got into an altercation at a bodega three days ago. He was gone by the time the cops showed up, but the shopkeeper says he was fighting with some other guy over money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This other guy have a name?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Tony Valtini.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy’s got a record, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Damn right he does. I remember Valtini from back in Narcotics. The guy is totally mobbed up. You know what else? His family owns a meat packing plant out in Jersey. Tony’s nickname? Tony the Butcher.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I bet he split a few sides of beef in his day.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Yeah, I had words with Faris. He used to work for me at Tony Valtini Enterprises.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which division? Drug sales or distribution of stolen property?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: I am a legitimate businessman. Faris sucked at his job, so I canned him. He thought I owed him back pay. We settled it like gentlemen. If you don’t believe me, go ask him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’d have to hold a séance.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: He’s dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s just say Tyler Faris is half the man he used to be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A man divided? Split personality? Really, nothing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was cleaved, in two, with a sword.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: A sword?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Much like the knives used at a meat packing plant.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: Oh, hey, it wasn’t me. I had nothing to do with it. But, I know who did. It was that guy. That nut-job vigilante who attacked me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You never reported an attack.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: I don’t like to be a burden on law enforcement. Bottom line is, I’m leaving my warehouse one night. Two weeks ago. All of a sudden, here comes this guy with a sword. He accuses me of criminal conduct, unjustly, by the way, then he threatens to kill me if I don’t leave town. Then … You know what he does then?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does he do then?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: He cuts me.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: See that? See that scar there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like an L.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Valtini, could you please put your pants back on –

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: He did that to me! He did that with his sword, to me. Okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did this man look like?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: You wouldn’t believe me if I told you, okay?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: But, I got cameras in my warehouse. When he ran off, I caught him on video.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The time code lines up with the night Valtini said he was attacked.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: According to ER records, he was admitted that night. Knifing to the buttocks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The sword of justice, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, is that…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It can’t be.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our killer is a superhero!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Really? A superhero?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Our witness from the alley confirms that she saw this man kill Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Why didn’t she say that before?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She didn’t think that we’d believe her. And quite frankly, she’s right.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A masked vigilante on the loose hacking people up. Tell me what your plan is to apprehend this individual.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re uh… we’re looking for murders with the same MO. We’re also checking into enemies that Tyler Faris and Tony Valtini might have had in common. And finally we’re trying to track down where that suit and sword came from.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Reach out to Bellevue, they probably admitted our suspect before. He’s clearly delusional or psychotic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Keep me apprised, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t waste your time on Bellevue.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were eavesdropping?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I help it if I have superhuman Daredevil-like hearing? Our killer is not crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He cut a man in two and he’s running around wearing a superhero suit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know costumes. That one is not commercial. He probably designed it himself, which means he’s highly functional.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what I would love right now is if someone would come here and give me a theory that would actually help me solve this case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve got one. Every superhero has a persona, a mission, a origin story. Learning who he is as a hero, what drives him, that will lead us to the man behind the mask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what good is comic book mythology when our killer is not a superhero?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if he is a superhero? Like this one, who operates out of Queens. Meet the Red Maroon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Red Maroon? Isn’t that redundant?

utterance.speaker: RED MAROON
utterance.content: Don’t worry ma’am, Red Maroon, protector of all, beholden to none!

utterance.speaker: RED MAROON
utterance.content: Sir … this is clearly not your purse. I demand you unhand it!

utterance.speaker: RED MAROON
utterance.content: Ma’am, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Impressive crime fighting skills. What do you think, mutant powers or years of training?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes well, sometimes the runner stumbles. The point is, there is a subculture of real life superheroes that actually exists out there. People crusading for the public good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, and usually they get their asses kicked, just like this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think our vigilante’s one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, if he’s a crusader for the public good, then why did he partition Tyler Faris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, because tragically his pursuit of justice has led him down the dark side. That is a fate that has befallen many a hero.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheers. Trust me. I’m onto something with this superhero angle. My Spidey senses are tingling.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s with him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something about Spidey senses and tingling.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Photos from the alley?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We may have a suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tech says that guy matches the height and build of the guy in the suit. Not only that, when he saw the cops taking his pictures he ran.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, have uniforms circulate his photo. I want to know his name.

utterance.speaker: EPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, Castle might be right about this guy being a superhero. I talked to a buddy of mine in Narcotics. He said he heard rumors about a guy on the street rousting drug dealers and dumping their stashes. A masked man with a sword. Yes, it is a samurai sword, so we’re checking specialty stores and martial arts suppliers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the costume?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not available in any stores. Just like Castle said.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of costumes, I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Behold, a photo of our masked vigilante juxtaposed with issues from my own Marvel collection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have Avengers #1?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there’s more where that came from. You’re welcome to peruse my issues anytime. Please note how the killer has drawn inspiration from costumes of other superheroes. For example, the color scheme evokes Spider-Man. The horned helmet, obviously an homage to Daredevil. The sword and scabbard, Deadpool. The high collar, just like Black Panther. Now, what do these characters all have in common?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’re make believe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re driven by the death of a father figure or loved one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I believe that our killer shares a similar back story. Which is why he’s been inspired by these characters' costumes. Furthermore, out of costume, these heroes tend to be … unassuming. So, let’s add mild mannered to our profile.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. So this is you working a homicide.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: A superhero who’s mild mannered and someone killed his parents. Isn’t that all of them? How can any of this produce even one useful conclusion?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me direct your attention to the golden belt worn by our masked vigilante. Based on the golden belt worn by Iron Man in only eleven original issues in 1963.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Which proves what, exactly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our killer collected comic books. Which means there is one place in the city he would definitely go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Castle, you might want to tone down the theories until Gates warms up to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I plan to melt Captain Permafrost by solving this case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, good luck with that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa. You smell that? Wafting scent of printed pages? Comicadia. Beckett, this place is the premiere comic book shop. It’s the Vatican to a Catholic. It’s Mecca to a pilgrim. It’s upstream to a spawning –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know, Castle. I bought my first comic here when I was fourteen. Sin City. "A Dame to Kill For."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How hardcore! Okay, wait, wait, wait … if you could be any comic book character in the world, who would you be?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Elektra.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. A ruthless assassin who hides from her emotions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, maybe it’s because she’s got bad-ass ninja skills.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about you? Iron Man? Spider-Man? No wait, I know. Annoying Man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. Try billionaire industrialist Bruce Wayne, aka The Dark Knight. He’s brooding, he’s handsome, and he has all the coolest toys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow. Digging deep on that one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did I mention what discerning tastes they have here at Comicadia?

utterance.speaker: MIKE HOOVER
utterance.content: Mr. Castle. And you’re Kate Beckett, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Sir, I am a huge fan. It is such an honor to meet you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the honor is mine.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: We just got your Derrick Storm graphic novel. I mean, the art, the writing … it is, in a word, awesome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me, what’s your favorite part?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, you don’t have to answer that question. His ego does not need any more feeding.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Definitely where Derrick Storm escapes from the two bad guys by crashing the –

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Oh! I’m sorry, Detective Beckett, I should have said spoiler alert.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that’s okay. I won’t be reading it.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Really? I saw your name on our list. You pre-ordered a copy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was just being supportive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyway, we’re not here about that. We need to ask you a few questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, we do. I don’t suppose you know of any collectors of early Iron Man.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Mr. Castle. I can’t share customer information.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mike, do you recognize this man?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Uh … no. He doesn’t look familiar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about this one?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Yeah, him I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You do? Really?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The sword, the suit … that’s our vigilante.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lone Vengeance. That explains the L he carved into Tony Valtini’s backside, but Sword of Lone Vengeance? How come I’ve never seen this?

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Oh, it’s online only. It’s kind of fringe, but it has a following. A guy named Sean Elt writes it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like you put more thought into the killer’s costume than he did, Castle. It’s a direct copy out of the comic book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve seen that before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The knuckle plates? Where?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On the ground, at the crime scene. I thought it was a button. But this is it, that’s what it was. It fell off of his suit. If we can find that, if it’s still there, it could lead us to the killer.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uniforms widened their canvass. Still can’t find anyone that knows our mystery man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ah, whoever he is, I can’t connect him to any swords, either. I pray we nail this dude before I have to call every store on that list.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I thought you were kind of rooting for this guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s when he was Joe Citizen taking it to the bad guys. Now he’s just some nimrod in a suit.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah. You gotta give him props for spirit, though, right? I mean, haven’t you ever wanted to be a superhero? Going out there, prowling the city, knocking some heads?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I do that now. Yeah, I’m still here. You did? When? Be right there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Jake’s pawn shop sold a samurai sword to some guy two hours ago. They say he matches our photo of our mystery man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe he’s replacing the one he broke off in Tyler Faris?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was here. I know it was here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe somebody picked it up. Or maybe it was a button.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No … it was … ah! Ah ha! There it is. That is no button.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is a piece of his costume.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re right. Castle, I think there’s a partial print on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Stop!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How cool was that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which part? That that was our murderer, or that he just got away? I gotta call in an APB.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, I gotta call you back.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, you’re going to want to hear this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we just saw our suspect. He fled the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And I know where to find him, because I know who he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? How?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he bought a samurai sword at a pawn shop today. And now, get this. He paid for it with a check. His name is, uh, Chad Hockney. His photo matches the mystery man from the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s his address?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD! Do not move a muscle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless you can move faster than a speeding bullet.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: This man? He’s our killer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, to be fair, it … he was a lot more imposing in a dark alley. With a sword.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he lives four blocks away from the crime scene and CSU is going through his apartment right now to find … evidence to link him to the murder.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Tie this up in a bow, Detective. Get me a confession.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sit down, Mr. Hockney.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Uh, look. This is just a big misunderstanding. I’m on your guys’ side here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our side doesn’t execute criminals.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: See … yeah, neither do I.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except for last night’s episode of two half men.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have a witness, Chad. She saw you kill Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then, like a moth to a flame, you were inexorably drawn back to the scene of the crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is when you realized you lost part of your suit, so you came back to get it. Or rather, take it from us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is all about your father, isn’t it? You’re driven by his death.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: My father is in Miami. I – I don’t know what you people are talking about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying you weren’t in the alley, slapping my hand with your sword? And you didn’t kill Tyler Faris?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: No! I would never kill anyone. Neither would Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aren’t you Lone Vengeance?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Not the real one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The real one being the comic book character?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Comic book characters aren’t real, okay?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: I mean the guy who assumed the persona of the comic book character.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who’s that?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: No one knows. And he’s a legend in the superhero community. I dreamed of being him when I was Red Maroon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Protector of all, beholden to none?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: You’ve heard of me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We saw the purse snatching video.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Yeah. That. Ugh. That hit the web and pretty much turned Red Maroon into a joke. Those were dark days. I was about ready to hang up my tights for good. Then I decided to seek out Lone Vengeance’s council.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did he say?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: To stay the hell away from him. But that – that only steeled my resolve. I mean, I made this costume. I got a sword. I was about to go out on patrol when you guys busted in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you find him?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: I – I heard that Lone Vengeance, uh, frequented lower Manhattan. I – I roamed the streets night after night looking for him. I finally ran into him, uh, near Beakman in Theater Alley. I want to be his disciple. Maybe his partner. It’s – it’s my destiny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He doesn’t want a partner.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lone Vengeance. Lone.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do you mean you can’t make a case against him? He’s wearing the same suit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, apparently he’s not the only one. Chad Hockney was in his apartment making that suit the night of the murder. In fact, neighbors were complaining about the noise from the sewing machine.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I told the Mayor we had our man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you shouldn’t have done that.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Perhaps what I shouldn’t have done was place my faith in you, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys, where are we on the motorcycle?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Checking registrations on silver Kawasakis.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re also canvassing around Beakman for other sightings of Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, let’s put in a court order for the names of all of the people who downloaded the Lone Vengeance comics. One of them might be our murderer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To the untrained eye, this might look like a grown man reading comic books, but –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ve been thinking about this, Dad. I think you should be happy for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am. I am. I’m just going to miss you, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Me too. But this is what I want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come. Tell me about your classes. What will you be taking come January?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, Intro to Statistics. Microeconomic Theory. The Economic Theory of the Islamic Middle East.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn’t Ashley an economics major? Don’t – are you just taking his classes?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That way we can spend more time together. What’s wrong with that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To quote Spider-Man, “with great power comes great responsibility”. Not a lot of people get a chance to go to a school like this. You need to think about your dreams and what you want.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This is what I want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is what Ashley wants.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This wasn’t even his idea. It was mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, this can’t be all about Ashley, Alexis. I mean, what if you guys break up? What then?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’re not going to break up! Why are you trying to talk me out of this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not. I’m – I’m just trying to stop you from making irrational choices.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Why does everything I do have to make sense? Why can’t I just do what I want once in awhile? It’s all you ever do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should’ve – I should have called.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yoga, Castle. I was doing yoga. C’mon in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gotcha.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I found something that will shock and amaze you. I downloaded all of the Sword of Lone Vengeances.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is not shocking or amazing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t let me finish. I was looking for clues as to the killer’s identity in the comic books. I didn’t find any. But check out what I did find. Take a look at these panels. The hoodlum leaves his warehouse. Lone Vengeance swoops in and then carves the letter L in his right cheek. Who does that remind you of?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tony the Butcher.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I checked the dates on the issue. It came out after Lone Vengeance attacked him. These panels emulate that event. The only other person there was our vigilante.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you’re saying that –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It has to be. Our killer is the writer of this comic book. Sean Elt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you. Sean Elt doesn’t exist. His name is an alias.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or a nom de plume, as we writers say. Though, why anyone would choose Sean Elt … wait a minute. It’s an anagram. Change the letters around and you get –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stan Lee. Comic book genius.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me. He is no Stan Lee. He’s not even Sean Elt.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, all right. Thanks Bill. Maybe next time.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So no help from tech on the real name. The Lone Vengeance website is registered solely to Sean Elt.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, whoever he is, he put more than Tony the Butcher in his comics. I found two more real life incidents that wound up as storylines. Lone Vengeance shook down a drug dealer and here he set a truck full of flat screens on fire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, pull up a copy of the two police reports, see if they have anything in common.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something doesn’t add up. Lone Vengeance stamps out crime, both in the comics and real life. He’s into this vigilante style ass-kicking, or in Tony’s case, ass-carving, but never murder. So why would he suddenly kill Tyler Faris? And why in such a brutal way?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Sword of Lone Vengeance, this time it’s personal?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That has to be it. Tyler Faris must have known Sean Elt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did your son ever hang out with the comic book crowd? Was he into comics?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he ever mention the writer of that comic? Was he hanging out with anyone out of the ordinary lately?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Somebody mild mannered, perhaps?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As in, mask and cape?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could describe him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fair hair with a beard.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A green press badge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our suspect is one Paul Whittaker. Former graphic artist who works the crime beat for the New York Ledger. He’s also a no show at work and he’s not at home, either. We put out an APB and we flagged his credit cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, that makes perfect sense. As a crime reporter, Paul would see firsthand how lawlessness would ravage a community. Compelled to do more than just write about it, he would don a mask and form-fitting tights to become Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: But his plan to purge the streets hit a snag when Tyler Faris threatened to reveal his secret identity, causing Lone Vengeance to cut him down in a single fearsome blow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The student has become the master. Or at least, he tried. Actually, for a truly Castle-esque theory, it has to be fully thought through.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Since when?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I did think it through.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Then how did Tyler Faris know that Paul Whittaker was Lone Vengeance?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I got that one. Just got off with the Ledger. Turns out that our reporter, Paul Whittaker, has a burner cell phone that he uses to talk to confidential sources. It’s the same number that Tyler Faris made calls to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Faris was a source or a paid informant. So that’s how they knew each other.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So maybe Faris was tipping off Paul about crimes going down in the neighborhood, but Lone Vengeance kept showing up instead. And that is how Faris knew that Lone Vengeance was actually Paul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He confronted Paul, threatened to expose him –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Paul Whittaker killed him to hide his identity as a half-assed superhero?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, it’s perfect superhero psychology. It’s symbiosis. See, Lone Vengeance is a part of Paul Whittaker. Yin and yang. One can’t exist without the other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, seal off the area.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul Whittaker just maxed out his ATM at 71st and 7th.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. That is one block away from Comicadia.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: MIKE
utterance.content: Two grand for all this? Man, you’ve got a Hulk #181 here. That alone is worth, like –

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I just need the money. In cash.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Look, I’m in a bit of a hurry here, so …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Where are you off to, Mr. Whittaker?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or should we say, Lone Vengeance?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Really. Our killer is a writer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, writers can be men of action.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve yet to see that, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: So he’s a journalist like Peter Parker.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, Peter Parker was a news photographer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, our guy is more like Clark Kent. And he’s mild mannered, just like… I… predicted.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective, I’d like to call the Mayor, let him know that we caught our killer. Try to get a confession this time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think she’s warming up to you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re searching your apartment now, Paul. We found this artwork there. We know you were behind Sword of Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Well … there’s no law against that, is there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except you took it a lot farther than just making a comic book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, it’s only a matter of time before we find the suit and the murder weapon.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Lone Vengeance stands for all that is good and virtuous. An army of one at war against crime. A defender of the innocent. It’s just a character I create. It’s not someone real.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to this, you were mugged last year outside an abandoned tenement building?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Oh, it’s – it’s New York. People – people get mugged.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only the mugger got the worst of it. You ended up with a few stitches, the mugger ended up in the hospital and cops say that you were non-compliant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a critical moment in the arc of every superhero. An awakening that transforms him, that drives him to embrace his destiny. For you, the mugging was that moment. That’s when Lone Vengeance was born.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you used the Sword of Lone Vengeance as your comic book diary. We know you killed Tyler Faris, Paul. Your life is over. Both of your lives. You’re going to prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you think those cons are going to do when they find out that you ran around in tights? If you help us, if you confess, I will keep you safe. I will get you placed in segregated housing. Now that is a good deal, Paul. I would take it if I were you.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, okay. It’s me. I’m Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Tyler Faris found out?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Yeah, he threatened to expose me, so I killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to need you to write that down, Paul.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said Lone Vengeance stands for all that is good. So he has a code. So killing someone, someone like Tyler Faris, violated that code. In a typical superhero that would trigger a crisis of faith. You must have been conflicted. How did you feel when you killed Tyler Faris?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: Well, I – I felt bad. I felt really bad.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paul, why did you chop off Tyler’s hand after you killed him?

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: I don’t know. I – I just did. Can I – can I write my confession now? Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you sure he didn’t do it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, Faris’s hand was chopped off before he was killed. Paul didn’t know that.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then why did he confess?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because Paul is protecting the real killer. Paul is the writer, Lone Vengeance is the subject. That’s their relationship. It’s you and me, all over again. But I’m Paul and you’re Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really, Castle? Is that how you see me? Like a sword wielding killer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Depends. Will you be scantily clad?

utterance.speaker: BECKTT
utterance.content: In your dreams.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not to rain on your comic book fantasy, but if Paul is not Lone Vengeance it puts a whole new spin on his mugging.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right, it does. I bet Paul didn’t beat up that mugger. I bet that was Lone Vengeance. I bet that’s probably how they met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. That abandoned tenement building where Paul was mugged. Where is that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Near Beakman. In Theater Alley.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s the same place where Chad Hockney found Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So either that’s a coincidence …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or that’s where he hangs out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: An abandoned tenement building. Perfect place for a superhero lair.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure this is the place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Power company said that unit 209 is the only one with electricity. Somebody tied it up to a pole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, if this is a lair, can I just say … disappointing. I mean, where’s the mood lighting? Glass case with fifty samurai swords?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh ah ah. All right. It’s a modest lair, built on a budget. Wonder what else he’s got hidden around here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett. Got a guy on the fire escape heading your way. I think it’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Don’t move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t do that if I were you. There are cops everywhere downstairs. Now, very slowly, take off that mask.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Officer Hastings?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I did not see that coming.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you believe it? Lone Vengeance, sword wielding killer, ends up being one of our own.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. Maybe she had her reasons.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa. Maybe she had her reasons? What happened to nimrod in a suit?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s before I knew she was a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: CSU is going over your suit and they’re looking for Tyler Faris’ blood.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: They won’t find any.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you would know how to clean it up.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: I always admired you, Detective. The kind of cop that you are, it made me want to get to know you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you could’ve been that kind of a cop. Awards, first rate evaluation … why did you let it go?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: My father owned a dry cleaner's in the neighborhood. He got held up, by some junkie probably. Shot dead over eighty bucks. The day after I buried him I applied to the Academy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then you decided to take the law into your own hands. Being a cop wasn’t enough?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Someone killed my dad. Nothing will ever be enough. But doing what I do makes me feel better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We arrested Ann. I just thought you should know.

utterance.speaker: PAUL
utterance.content: You’re probably wondering why I confessed, then.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re in love with her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You crossed the line, Ann.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Don’t pretend that we’re so different.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s talk about Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Didn’t you lose your mom?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not here to discuss that.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Didn’t you shoot the guy who killed her, right here in this precinct? The bullet that you took, isn’t that connected to her murder, too? Because that’s the rumor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I am not like you. I didn’t chop a man in half.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Neither did I.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, you did. And you’ve got Paul Whittaker so turned around over it that he tried to confess to your murder.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Paul? Why would he do that? Damnit, I told him to leave town until I got this sorted out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, you’ve got it sorted out now.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: I did not kill Tyler Faris. I threw up my breakfast when I saw that body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were in the alley with me, Ann. You took that piece from your suit.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: It wasn’t from my suit. And the only reason I wanted it was to figure out who’s behind this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually expect me to believe you?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: It’s true. I saw that disk at the crime scene. I knew it wasn’t mine. But before I could get it, I got sent off to canvass. So I came back for it, and yes, I took it from you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you do with it?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: I had a friend in the crime lab run it for prints. It came back with a partial, but it wasn’t in the criminal database. Look, if you don’t believe me, ask him. He still has it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So somebody else dressed up as Lone Vengeance and killed our victim?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: It’s the only thing that makes sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How does that make sense?

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Because it wasn’t me. I came across something when I canvassed Matt’s bar where Tyler Faris came from. He was a creature of habit. He drank there every night. He’d always leave between one and two and take the backdoor to the alley. Usually with a girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying that the killer knew that Faris was going to show up in that alley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she didn’t kill Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I just – I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if she didn’t do it and Chad Hockney didn’t do it, then we’re looking at a third Lone Vengeance. A clever imposter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so let’s suppose that our killer is an imposter. That would mean that he targeted Tyler Faris and wore a costume, either to make sure that no one could identify him –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or to make sure he would be identified and frame Lone Vengeance for the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And Tyler Faris was the perfect victim.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he shows up in a dark alley like clockwork and brings his own witness.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so maybe our killer was a criminal who wanted Lone Vengeance off the streets.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A criminal who wanted vengeance from Lone Vengeance and Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone who knew Tyler and his habits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone who had experience wielding a blade.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone who pointed us to Lone Vengeance in the first place.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: You think I killed Tyler Faris. C’mon. You’re dreaming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know you wanted Lone Vengeance off the streets. He was costing you money. We read the comics. Lone Vengeance was shaking down your dealers, burning your trucks. So when Faris thought that he figured out Lone Vengeance’s true identity he knew you’d pay top dollar for it.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: All right, even if this were true, which it’s not … I’ve got no motive for murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve had to be asking yourself, all these times Lone Vengeance was harassing your people, how did he know where to go? Who was tipping him off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, it had to have been someone from the inside, someone with an axe to grind. Someone just like Tyler Faris.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you figured why not kill two birds with one stone? Get rid of Faris and hang the murder on Lone Vengeance.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: And that’s it. That’s all you’ve got?

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: You guys call yourselves cops? You’ve got to be embarrassed. Here’s the problem. You got no proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we do. That’s from your outfit. We matched the partial print to your cousin, Ernesto.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The tailor. I’ve heard great things about his custom made shirts. But he also confessed to making a Lone Vengeance outfit… for you.

utterance.speaker: TONY
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you will need one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Those are your personal effects, you probably want to make sure everything is there.

utterance.speaker: HASTINGS
utterance.content: Thanks, Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ann, you’re a good cop. And you’ve got somebody that cares about you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t be so driven by the past that you throw away your future. Take care.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, a murder solved and a notorious hoodlum off the streets for good. I call that a solid win.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I agree. All because of the hard work and dedication of this team.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, thank you, Captain. That means a lot.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Of police officers. Team of police officers, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective. About Officer Hastings. She uh, fled the alley when you ordered her to stop. Some reason you’re not pressing any charges?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I, uh –

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Think that given the number of folks wearing that costume, we can’t prove that it was her in that alley. Or anywhere else, for that matter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: She’s a promising officer. That said, it would be bad for all of us if Lone Vengeance were to show up ever again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think that that will be a problem, sir.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, let’s make sure it isn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Either she just grew a heart…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or she’s worried about how it would look if the press found out that Lone Vengeance was one of our own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A writer and his muse, fighting crime. Just like us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, hello Mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Falstaff!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Really? It’s King Lear. Oh… I have work to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, hey. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Skyping with Ashley, but we just finished.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, even when you were a little girl, you were a serious person. I think I’ve just gotten used to you being sensible and mature. Even more than me sometimes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Sometimes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Point taken. Thing is, Alexis, I know there are other sides to you. Impulsive sides. Romantic sides. And I don’t want you to deny them.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You were right. With great power does come great responsibility. I’ve always been good at doing what I’m supposed to. But college is about doing what you want. You know, following your passion. I’m picking my own classes. I don’t know which ones yet, but um … no economics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what? Even if you’re not in classes with Ashley, you’ll still see each other plenty.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. Especially if we move in together.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
